5bb3ae25da3c38c71367bcc4.name: Elementary & Secondary Schools
5bb3ae25da3c38c71367bcc4.description: Preschool, elementary and secondary schools that provide a formal education for children and adolescents in kindergarten or first grade through grade twelve.

5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc5.name: Preschools
5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc5.description: Separately organized preschools or nursery schools and/or kindergartens which provide foundation-level learning for children (usually age two through five and four and one half or five respectively) prior to entering the formal school setting.

5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc6.name: Primary & Elementary Schools
5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc6.description: Schools classified as elementary by state and local practice and composed of any span of grades not above grade eight. Includes preschools and kindergartens if they are an integral part of an elementary school or a regularly established school system.

5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc7.name: Secondary & High Schools
5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc7.description: Schools comprising any span of grades beginning with the next grade following an elementary school and ending at or below grade 12. Includes junior high schools or intermediate schools and high schools which provide formal instruction for students who want to prepare further education at the college level or for employment following graduation.

5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc8.name: Special Education
5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc8.description: Organizations that provide educational services including special placement and individualized programming, instruction and support services for children and youth who are gifted or have disabilities and require appropriately modified curricula, teaching methodologies and instructional materials in order to learn.

5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc9.name: Charter Schools
5bb3ae26da3c38c71367bcc9.description: Schools run independently of the traditional public school system but receiving public funding and operating by a charter.  This performance contract details the schools mission, program, goals, students served, method of assessment, and ways to measure success.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcca.name: Vocational & Technical Schools
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcca.description: Separately organized trade high schools or vocational centers that provide formal preparation for semiskilled, skilled, technical or professional occupations for high-school-aged students and, in some cases, adults who want to develop skills for employment.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccb.name: Higher Education
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccb.description: Educational institutions that provide opportunities for individuals to acquire a higher level of knowledge, skills and specialization in their chosen area of interest in a formal school setting.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccc.name: Two-Year Colleges
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccc.description: Postsecondary educational institutions, known alternatively as community colleges or junior colleges and commonly organized into two-year programs, that offer instruction that has been adapted in content, level and schedule to meet the needs of the community in which they are located. Community or junior colleges award an Associates in Arts (A.A.) certificate.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccd.name: Undergraduate Colleges
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccd.description: Educational institutions that offer college level courses of study that may lead to the customary bachelor of arts or science degree.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcce.name: Universities
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcce.description: Postsecondary educational institutions that offer postgraduate study at masters or doctorate levels in addition to an undergraduate program for people who meet entry level requirements and are interested in an advanced education. Some institutions of university status are known as colleges or institutes.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccf.name: Graduate & Professional Schools
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bccf.description: Separately incorporated postsecondary educational institutions provide opportunities for people who have completed their undergraduate education to receive advanced, postgraduate training in a professional field leading to a masters degree or doctorate.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd0.name: Adult Education
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd0.description: Institutions outside the formal system of regular schools, colleges, universities and technical/trade schools that provide opportunities for adults to develop basic learning and communication skills, complete their high school education, expand their knowledge in a particular field or discipline or develop skills in a new area of interest.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd1.name: Libraries
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd1.description: Facilities which house a collection of materials including books, manuscripts, journals, government documents and non-print formats such as paintings, musical recordings, videotapes, films and data files which are organized for access by a targeted population.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd2.name: Educational Services
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd2.description: Organizations that provide educational programs within the formal educational system or offered as an adjunct to the traditional school curriculum which help students succeed in school and prepare for life.  Includes organizations that partner parents, families, schools, business and/or community leaders to broker resources for the benefit of local schools.
keywords: Century Community Learning Centers Initiative Programs

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd3.name: Remedial Reading & Encouragement
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd3.description: Organizations that provide diagnostic testing and/or individual or group instruction for people who are having reading difficulties. Instruction focuses on phonics, dictionary skills, vocabulary development, spelling and study skills, comprehension and memory skills.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd4.name: Parent & Teacher Groups
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd4.description: Organizations of parents, educators, students, and other citizens who are active in their schools and communities promoting the health, education, and welfare of children.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd5.name: Education Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd5.description: Organizations that clearly provide education services where the major purpose is unclear cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd6.name: Pollution Abatement & Control
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd6.description: Organizations which seek to ensure that communities have a clean and healthful environment that is free from air and water pollution, pesticides and other hazardous substances, damaging radiation and excessive levels of noise.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd7.name: Environmental Education
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd7.description: Organizations such as nature centers that provide informal classes which acquaint participants with particular aspects of their environment and increase their understanding of and appreciation for ecological balance.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd8.name: Animal Protection & Welfare
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd8.description: Organizations such as animal shelters that provide for the humane care, protection and control of animals and which investigate instances of cruelty to animals.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd9.name: Hospitals
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcd9.description: Twenty-four hour medical institutions that provide diagnostic and treatment services for people whose illnesses require an overnight stay. Most hospitals also provide a variety of services on an outpatient basis.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcda.name: Community Health Systems
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcda.description: Multihospital health care systems that have two or more hospitals owned, leased, sponsored, or managed by a central organization.  Also includes parent companies of diversified single hospital systems that provide comprehensive management and support services for the hospital.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcdb.name: General Hospitals
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcdb.description: Health care facilities that are licensed to operate twenty-four hours per day and offer diagnostic and treatment services as well as emergency and critical care services for people who have illnesses or injuries which require immediate, short-term intervention.

5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcdc.name: Specialty Hospitals
5bb3ae27da3c38c71367bcdc.description: Health care facilities like orthopedic hospitals or cancer hospitals that provide diagnostic and treatment services on an inpatient basis for people who have specified medical conditions.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcdd.name: Ambulatory & Primary Health Care
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcdd.description: Health centers, clinics, and other facilities that provide walk-in, walk-out diagnostic and treatment services for people whose care does not require confinement or a hospital stay.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcde.name: Group Health Practices
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcde.description: Organizations that provide both health care services and underwrite health and medical insurance. Also included are medical groups which provide health care for HMO members on a contract with the HMO and physician practice groups generally associated with teaching, research, and public hospitals.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcdf.name: Community Clinics
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcdf.description: Outpatient facilities, many previously known as free clinics, established by the community rather than a hospital which provide basic medical care including physical examinations, immunizations, family planning, nutrition assistance and diagnosis and treatment of common ailments. Services are available on an ability-to-pay basis and target low-income and indigent community residents.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce0.name: Reproductive Health Care
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce0.description: Organizations that provide medical, educational and counseling services which relate to the conception, delivery and care of offspring.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce1.name: Family Planning
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce1.description: Organizations that provide assistance for people who want to control the size of their families and the spacing of their children, either through some form of birth control or naturally.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce2.name: Rehabilitative Care
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce2.description: Organizations that provide, on an outpatient basis, a combination of treatment and education services to restore maximum functioning, a sense of well-being and a personally satisfying level of independence for individuals who have temporary or permanent disabilities.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce3.name: Health Support
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce3.description: Organizations that provide equipment, services or other forms of support which are supplemental to the treatment or rehabilitation of people who have illnesses, injuries or disabilities; or which are instrumental in the prevention of illnesses, injuries or disabilities prior to their occurrence.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce4.name: Blood Banks
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce4.description: Organizations that acquire, process, type, transport and store whole blood and blood products including red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets and plasma constituents for use by people who need transfusions; and which conduct pretransfusion compatibility tests to ensure that blood transfusions, when necessary, are as safe as possible.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce5.name: Emergency Medical Services & Transport
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce5.description: Organizations that provide pre-hospital emergency medical care and rapid transportation to health care facilities.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce6.name: Organ & Tissue Banks
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce6.description: Organizations that accept donated hearts, kidneys, livers, skin and other organs and tissue for use in transplant operations.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce7.name: Public Health
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce7.description: Organizations that inform the public of health and safety hazards and measures for furthering the early detection, treatment or rehabilitation of people who have an illness, injury or disability.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce8.name: Health (General & Financing)
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce8.description: Organizations that are concerned primarily with one or more aspects of health financing or that provide services which relate to health care in general.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce9.name: Patient & Family Support
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bce9.description: Organizations that provide support services to patients and their families.  Programs can include social and recreational activities for people who are recovering from surgery or a serious illnesses; supportive services for children who are ill and for their families which enable family members to remain with a child who is hospitalized; family and sibling support groups, and programs which attempt to make a gravely or terminally ill childs final days, weeks and months more pleasant.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcea.name: Nursing
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcea.description: Organizations that provide nursing care on an inpatient or home-care basis for people who need continuous care but are not in an acute phase of their illness.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bceb.name: Nursing Facilities
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bceb.description: Inpatient facilities, also known as convalescent hospitals and nursing homes, that provide skilled nursing and personal care over an extended period of time for people who are no longer in an acute phase of their illness.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcec.name: Home Health Care
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcec.description: Visiting nurse associations and other similar organizations that provide skilled nursing care and related health services on a home care basis for recently discharged hospital patients, and elderly or disabled individuals who may otherwise be institutionalized.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bced.name: Health Care Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bced.description: Organizations that clearly provide medical care services where the major purpose is unclear enough that a more specific code cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcee.name: Substance Abuse Dependency, Prevention & Treatment
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcee.description: Organizations that provide preventive, diagnostic and inpatient, outpatient and residential treatment services as well as transitional support for people who have a physical and/or psychological dependency on alcohol and/or drugs.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcef.name: Substance Abuse Prevention
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcef.description: Organizations that provide substance abuse education programs for people who are at risk for substance abuse in an effort to prevent their involvement with drugs and/or alcohol.

5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcf0.name: Substance Abuse Treatment
5bb3ae28da3c38c71367bcf0.description: Organizations that provide inpatient, outpatient or residential treatment services for individuals who have a physical and/or psychological dependency on alcohol and/or drugs.
keywords: Twelve-Step Substance Abuse Mutual Support Groups

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf1.name: Mental Health Treatment
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf1.description: Organizations that provide preventive, diagnostic and treatment services in a variety of community and hospital-based settings to help people to achieve and maintain a state of emotional well-being, personal empowerment and the skills to cope with everyday demands without excessive stress.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf2.name: Psychiatric Hospitals
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf2.description: Organizations that provide diagnostic and inpatient treatment services for individuals who have acute or chronic mental or emotional disturbances, who require hospitalization.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf3.name: Community Mental Health Centers
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf3.description: Neighborhood-based organizations that offer counseling, medication and other mental health services for people who have acute or chronic mental or emotional disturbances.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf4.name: Residential Mental Health Treatment
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf4.description: Organizations that provide a therapeutic living environment in community-based facilities for adults or children with emotional and/or behavioral problems who require a structured, supervised treatment program which may include individual, group, family and other treatment modalities as appropriate.
keywords: Residential Treatment Facilities, Mental Health Related

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf5.name: Hot Lines & Crisis Intervention
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf5.description: Organizations that provide in-person or telephone assistance for people who are in acute emotional distress; who are a danger to themselves or to others; who are having suicidal feelings; or who are hysterical, frightened or otherwise unable to cope with a problem that requires immediate action.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf6.name: Sexual Assault Services
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf6.description: Organizations that provide telephone crisis intervention services or crisis, short-term and/or ongoing in-person counseling for people who have been sexually assaulted.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf7.name: Addictive Disorders Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf7.description: Organizations that provide counseling, medical treatment (where indicated) and other supportive services for individuals who have a psychological dependency involving a particular pattern of behavior, e.g., spending money, sexual compulsions and workaholic behavior.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf8.name: Smoking Addiction
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf8.description: Organizations that utilize a variety of techniques to help people who wish to control their dependence on nicotine and give up substances containing nicotine. Also included are smoking education/prevention programs that help persuade people to avoid the habit before they start.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf9.name: Eating Disorders & Addictions
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcf9.description: Organizations that provide diagnostic and treatment services for individuals who have anorexia nervosa, bulimarexia, bulimia or a related eating disorder.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfa.name: Gambling Addiction
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfa.description: Organizations that provide emotional support, information and guidance for people who are having difficulty controlling their compulsion to gamble.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfb.name: Counseling
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfb.description: Organizations that provide treatment services which may include emotional support, problem-solving assistance, information and guidance through a variety of counseling modalities for individuals who are having difficulty in coping with a traumatic experience or a personal relationship or in making the adjustments that are required by their particular stage in life.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfc.name: Mental Health Disorders
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfc.description: Organizations that provide preventive, diagnostic and treatment services that focus on a particular mental health disorder.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfd.name: Mental Health Associations
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfd.description: Organizations whose purpose is to promote social conditions that enhance the potential in the community for good mental health and to improve methods and facilities for treating mental illness.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfe.name: Mental Health & Crisis Intervention Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcfe.description: Organizations that clearly provide mental health services where the major purpose is unclear enough that a more specific code cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcff.name: Birth Defects & Genetic Diseases
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bcff.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of illnesses or conditions that are hereditary and passed from parent to offspring.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd00.name: Down Syndrome
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd00.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of Down Syndrome, a hereditary condition that results in mental retardation.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd01.name: Cancer
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd01.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of cancer. The associated medical specialty is medical oncology, a subspecialty of internal medicine.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd02.name: Breast Cancer
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd02.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of breast cancer.

5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd03.name: Diseases of Specific Organs
5bb3ae29da3c38c71367bd03.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases and conditions that affect specific organs or organ systems in the body.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd04.name: Eye Diseases, Blindness & Vision Impairments
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd04.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of blindness and diseases or other conditions that affect the eyes. The associated medical specialty is ophthalmology.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd05.name: Heart & Circulatory System Diseases & Disorders
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd05.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases or conditions, including stroke, that affect the heart, lungs and blood vessels. The related medical specialty is cardiovascular medicine, a subspecialty of internal medicine.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd06.name: Kidney Diseases
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd06.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases or conditions that affect the kidneys. The related medical specialty is nephrology, a subspecialty of internal medicine.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd07.name: Lung Diseases
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd07.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases or conditions that affect the lungs. The related medical specialty is pulmonary disease specialists.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd08.name: Brain Disorders
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd08.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases or conditions including brain injuries that affect the brain.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd09.name: Nerve, Muscle & Bone Diseases
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd09.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases or conditions that affect the nerves, muscles or bones.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0a.name: Arthritis
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0a.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of arthritis (including osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis), an inflammatory condition affecting the joints. The related medical specialty is rheumatology, a subspecialty of internal medicine, though rheumatology is broader and covers more conditions than arthritis.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0b.name: Epilepsy
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0b.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of epilepsy, a recurrent paroxysmal disorder of cerebral function that is characterized by sudden brief interruptions in or complete loss of consciousness, motor activity and/or sensory phenomena.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0c.name: Allergy-Related Diseases
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0c.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases and conditions that involve hypersensitivity to substances that do not normally cause a reaction.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0d.name: Asthma
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0d.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of asthma, a disorder of the bronchial system that is characterized by labored breathing and wheezing.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0e.name: Digestive Diseases & Disorders
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0e.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of diseases and conditions such as abdominal pain, ulcers, diarrhea or jaundice that affect the digestive system including the stomach, bowels, liver, gallbladder and related organs. The related medical specialty is gastroenterology, a subspecialty of internal medicine.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0f.name: Specifically Named Diseases
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd0f.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of specifically named diseases and conditions.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd10.name: AIDS
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd10.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of AIDS, a disease that impairs the functioning of the bodys immune system, leaving affected individuals vulnerable to illnesses that would not otherwise occur.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd11.name: Alzheimers Disease
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd11.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of Alzheimers disease, a form of presenile dementia which is caused by atrophy of the frontal and occipital lobes of the brain.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd12.name: Autism
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd12.description: Voluntary health organizations active in the prevention or treatment of autism, a developmental disability, usually evident by age three, which affects a childs ability to communicate, understand language, play and relate to others.

5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd13.name: Medical Disciplines
5bb3ae2ada3c38c71367bd13.description: Organizations that represent physicians who have special training and expertise in one clinical area of practice which focuses on a specific age group, an organ system of the body, or on complex scientific techniques developed to diagnose or treat certain types of disorders.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd14.name: Biomedicine & Bioengineering
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd14.description: Organizations that represent physicians who have advanced training in the development, implantation and utilization of cardiac pacemakers, cochlear implants and other hearing aids, artificial limbs and joints and other similar devices.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd15.name: Geriatrics
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd15.description: Organizations that represent physicians who have advanced training in the medical specialty which provides preventive, diagnostic and treatment services for elderly individuals who have diseases and conditions that are associated with the aging process.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd16.name: Neurology & Neuroscience
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd16.description: Organizations that represent physicians who have advanced training in the medical specialty which provides comprehensive medical management including preventive, diagnostic and treatment services for individuals who have diseases or injuries that affect the central, peripheral or autonomic nervous systems including the brain, cranial nerves, spinal cord, spinal nerves and other related structures.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd17.name: Pediatrics
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd17.description: Organizations that represent physicians who have advanced training in the biological, social and environmental factors that have an influence on a developing child and expertise in diagnosing and treating acute and chronic diseases that are common to children and youth.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd18.name: Surgical Specialties
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd18.description: Organizations that represent physicians who have advanced training in the medical specialty which diagnoses conditions which require surgical intervention and provide preoperative, operative and postoperative care for surgical patients.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd19.name: Voluntary Health Associations & Medical Disciplines Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd19.description: Organizations that clearly provide services related to diseases, disorders or medical spcialities where the major purpose is unclear enough that a more specific code cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd1a.name: Crime Prevention
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd1a.description: Organizations that provide information and services that help the public protect themselves from crime or which prevent its occurrence. Also included are organizations that provide a mechanism for reporting crimes.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd1b.name: Youth Violence Prevention
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd1b.description: Organizations that offer a variety of activities for youth who have demonstrated or are at risk for behavior which is likely to be unlawful or to involve them in the juvenile justice system. Also included are community councils, coalitions and other groups whose primary purpose is to prevent delinquency.

5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd1c.name: Correctional Facilities
5bb3ae2bda3c38c71367bd1c.description: Privately operated, community-based nonprofit correctional facilities for adults or juveniles who have been sentenced to imprisonment after conviction for an offense. These facilities serve the same function as government-operated programs, and most operate on a contract with the county or the state.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd1d.name: Half-Way Houses for Offenders & Ex-Offenders
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd1d.description: Community-based residential facilities which allow adult and juvenile offenders with satisfactory behavior to transition back to the community during the last months of their sentences or which provide congregate living arrangements and supportive services for ex-offenders to help them successfully reenter the community and become self-sufficient. These facilities are known as work release centers, prerelease centers, rehabilitation centers and group homes for juvenile offenders or status offenders.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd1e.name: Rehabilitation Services for Offenders
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd1e.description: Organizations that provide counseling, job seeking assistance and other nonresidential supportive services that help adult and/or juvenile offenders re-integrate into the community following their release from a correctional facility.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd1f.name: Inmate Support
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd1f.description: Organizations that provide emotional support, friendship, advice and guidance or other types of support for inmates while they are incarcerated and/or which facilitate contact between inmates and family members.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd20.name: Prison Alternatives
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd20.description: Organizations that provide intensive treatment and rehabilitation services for adult or juvenile offenders. The focus of the service is on rehabilitation of the offender rather than preparation for release into the community.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd21.name: Administration of Justice
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd21.description: Organizations that are concerned with court administration; court reform including the rights and privileges of prisoners, incarceration alternatives and other criminal justice issues; and alternatives to litigation.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd22.name: Dispute Resolution & Mediation
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd22.description: Organizations that provide mediation services which help individuals who are having a dispute discuss the situation and reach an agreement without resorting to litigation.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd23.name: Law Enforcement
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd23.description: Law enforcement associations, advisory councils or other nonprofit community groups that provide advice and direction for police departments; auxiliaries or other community-based organizations that collect and disburse money in aid of injured police officers or in support of local law enforcement activities; and other nonprofit groups that have an interest in law enforcement issues.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd24.name: Protection Against Abuse
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd24.description: Organizations that attempt to reduce the incidence of child abuse, elder abuse and spouse abuse in family settings through educational interventions which may focus on children of various ages, parents, people who work with families and/or the community at large.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd25.name: Spouse Abuse Prevention
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd25.description: Organizations that deal specifically with the prevention of domestic violence through educational interventions which may focus on batterers, people at risk for domestic violence, people who work with battered women and/or the community at large.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd26.name: Child Abuse Prevention
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd26.description: Organizations that deal specifically with the prevention of child abuse including incest through educational interventions which may focus on children of various ages, parents, people who work with families and/or the community at large.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd27.name: Sexual Abuse Prevention
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd27.description: Organizations that deal specifically with the prevention of sexual assault (for adults and children).

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd28.name: Legal Services
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd28.description: Organizations that provide general legal aid regarding criminal and/or civil matters at little or no cost for individuals who are economically disadvantaged.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd29.name: Public Interest Law
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd29.description: Organizations that primarily handle class action litigation and lawsuits related to issues of interest to the public in general rather than assisting individuals.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2a.name: Crime & Legal-Related Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2a.description: Organizations that clearly provide crime and legal related services where the major purpose is unclear enough that a more specific code cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2b.name: Employment Preparation & Procurement
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2b.description: Organizations that help people prepare for, find, secure and retain suitable employment.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2c.name: Vocational Counseling
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2c.description: Organizations that administer tests which measure the skills, abilities and interests of job seekers and help them make appropriate decisions regarding an occupational field or position.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2d.name: Job Training
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2d.description: Organizations that train people in the specific skills they will need to obtain employment in a particular industry or which provide work experience for youth or others who have no employment history.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2e.name: Vocational Rehabilitation
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd2e.description: Organizations that provide job training and employment experiences for individuals with disabilities, people who have been disabled by use of drugs or alcohol or people with emotional difficulties, with the objective of helping them to become economically self-sufficient.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd30.name: Sheltered Employment
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd30.description: Organizations that provide paid employment opportunities in a controlled, protected environment for people with disabilities who are unable to obtain competitive employment. Also included are work activity centers which provide personal and social development opportunities for participants who have demonstrated inconsequential production capacity.

5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd31.name: Food Programs
5bb3ae2cda3c38c71367bd31.description: Organizations that provide access to free or low-cost food products to children, seniors, or indigents by distributing groceries, providing meals, providing facilities for storing food or making available land on which people can grow their own produce.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd32.name: Food Banks & Pantries
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd32.description: Organizations that gather, store and distribute food to indigents at no charge or at low cost.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd33.name: Congregate Meals
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd33.description: Organizations (also known as nutrition sites or senior nutrition programs) that provide hot meals on a regular basis, usually for elderly individuals but also for disabled adults or other target populations.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd34.name: Soup Kitchens
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd34.description: Organizations that provide meals in a central location for indigent people.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd35.name: Meals on Wheels
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd35.description: Organizations that prepare and deliver regular hot meals to elderly individuals, people with disabilities or people with AIDS or other targeted conditions who are unable to shop and/or prepare food for themselves or to travel to a site where a meal is being served. Also known as home delivered meals.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd36.name: Nutrition
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd36.description: Organizations that provide information concerning the basic principles of healthful eating, food handling, food preparation and shopping skills. Included is information about the basic food groups, vitamin and mineral requirements, and the relationship of nutrition to the preservation of good health and the prevention of illness.
keywords: Special Supplemental Nutrition for Women, Infants and Children

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd37.name: Home Economics
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd37.description: Organizations that provide instruction that deals with the basic activities of homemaking including caring for and managing children, shopping for and preparing nutritious meals, maintaining a clean and safe living environment, and other in-home responsibilities.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd38.name: Housing Development, Construction & Management
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd38.description: Organizations that build, rehabilitate, manage and/or provide rental housing for low-income individuals and families, older adults and people with disabilities; or which make purchasable housing available to low or moderate income families by offering lower priced housing and/or affordable payment plans, by arranging for interest or mortgage subsidies or by involving eventual owners in the construction process (sweat equity).

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd39.name: Low-Income & Subsidized Rental Housing
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd39.description: Organizations that develop, rehabilitate, manage and/or provide rental housing that is available to people who qualify on the basis of income, age or disability for publicly subsidized housing e.g., HUD housing or housing assistance under Section 8 of the Housing and Urban Development Act.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3a.name: Senior Citizens Housing & Retirement Communities
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3a.description: Residential options exclusively for older adults who want to have a simpler, maintenance-free lifestyle and enjoy the company of peers with common interests, or who require a moderate amount of support in the activities of daily living to maintain independent living.
keywords: Section 202 Supportive Housing for the Elderly

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3b.name: Independent Housing for People with Disabilities
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3b.description: Organizations that develop, manage and/or provide rental housing with the availability of supportive services for individuals with disabilities.
keywords: Section 811 Supportive Housing for Persons with Disabilities.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3c.name: Housing Rehabilitation
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3c.description: Organizations that clear slums and renew or rehabilitate old housing and other structures including abandoned buildings in blighted and depressed residential neighborhoods in order to provide a safe, sanitary and pleasant place for people to live.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3d.name: Housing Search Assistance
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3d.description: Organizations that assist people to find available purchasable or rental housing which meets their individual needs.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3e.name: Temporary Housing
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3e.description: Organizations that provide a temporary place to stay for newcomers, travelers, people who are in crisis, or homeless individuals in the community.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3f.name: Homeless Shelters
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd3f.description: Organizations that provide a temporary place to stay for people who have no permanent housing.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd40.name: Housing Support
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd40.description: Organizations that provide supportive services which help people obtain and remain in suitable housing.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd41.name: Home Improvement & Repairs
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd41.description: Organizations that provide assistance for homeowners who need to upgrade their homes to make them attractive, safe, accessible and energy efficient.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd42.name: Housing Expense Reduction Support
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd42.description: Organizations that provide home purchase or construction loans; finance new living accommodations; or pay current housing and/or utility bills for people who cannot afford to make the payments themselves and who qualify for this service on the basis of need or income.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd43.name: Disaster Preparedness & Relief Services
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd43.description: Organizations that work to prevent, predict or control the effects of disasters (e.g. floods, earthquakes, fires, tornadoes), to educate or otherwise prepare individuals to cope with the effects of such disasters or to provide broad-based relief services to victims of such disasters.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd44.name: Search & Rescue Squads
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd44.description: Volunteer and other organizations that provide emergency rescue operations and/or lifesaving activities for people who are stranded, lost, accident victims, or exposed to other life-threatening dangers. Included may be organizations that participate in air rescue, mountain rescue, sea rescue, ski rescue, traffic accident rescue and urban search and rescue operations.

5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd45.name: Fire Prevention
5bb3ae2dda3c38c71367bd45.description: Organizations that are responsible for the control and extinction of fires; and the inspection of buildings, hillside property and industrial plants to ensure compliance with fire codes.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd46.name: Camps
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd46.description: Organizations that operate facilities for cooperative group living experiences in the out-of-doors; and which provide opportunities to learn campcraft, nature lore and conservation, and participate in a wide range of indoor and outdoor recreational, athletic and group social activities including cookouts.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd47.name: Physical Fitness & Community Recreational Facilities
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd47.description: Organizations that provide acreage and facilities for a broad range of recreational and fitness activities, sports and games.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd48.name: Community Recreational Centers
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd48.description: Organizations that operate centers which offer, at a single location, a variety of recreational facilities such as athletic fields and courts, a gymnasium, a swimming pool and public lockers. Recreational centers usually offer an organized program of activities for community residents and provide all necessary equipment.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd49.name: Parks & Playgrounds
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd49.description: Organizations that develop, maintain and make available to the general public recreational areas which are equipped with athletic fields and courts, campgrounds, picnic areas and a variety of recreational trails such as bridle trails, hiking trails, off-the-road vehicle trails and snowmobile trails.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4a.name: Youth Centers & Clubs
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4a.description: Organizations that provide supervised recreational and social activities for children and youth of all ages and backgrounds, but particularly for disadvantaged youth, through youth-oriented clubs or centers with the objective of building character and developing leadership and social skills among participants.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4b.name: Boys Clubs
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4b.description: Organizations specifically designated as Boys Clubs that provide a wide range of supervised activities and delinquency prevention services for children and youth of all ages and backgrounds, but particularly for disadvantaged youth, with the objective of building character and developing leadership and social skills among participants.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4c.name: Girls Clubs
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4c.description: Organizations specifically designated as Girls Clubs that provide a wide range of supervised activities and delinquency prevention services for children and youth of all ages and backgrounds, but particularly for disadvantaged youth, with the objective of building character and developing leadership and social skills among participants.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4d.name: Adult & Child Matching Programs
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4d.description: Programs, also known as adult/child mentoring programs, that provide male or female adult companionship, guidance and/or role models for young men or women.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4e.name: Big Brothers & Big Sisters
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4e.description: Organizations specifically designated as Big Brothers or Big Sisters that provide male or female adult companionship, guidance and/or role models for young men or women.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4f.name: Scouting
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd4f.description: Programs that provide opportunities for children and youth to develop individual and group initiative and responsibility, self-reliance, courage, personal fitness, discipline and other desirable qualities of character through participation in a wide range of organized recreational, educational and civic activities under the leadership of qualified adult volunteers.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd50.name: Boy Scouts of America
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd50.description: Organizations specifically designated as Boy Scouts of America troops and councils.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd51.name: Girl Scouts of the U.S.A.
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd51.description: Organizations specifically designated as Girl Scouts of the U.S.A. troops and councils.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd52.name: Camp Fire
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd52.description: Organizations specifically designated as Camp Fire programs.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd53.name: Youth Development Programs
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd53.description: Programs that provide opportunities for children and youth to participate in recreational, cultural, social and civic activities through membership in clubs and other youth groups with a special focus whose purpose is to help youngsters develop their potential and grow into healthy, educated, responsible and productive adults.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd54.name: Youth Community Service Clubs
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd54.description: Organizations like Key Club that provide opportunities for children and youth to make a contribution to their local community through volunteer service projects. The purpose of the organization is to develop leadership skills and good citizenship practices in youngsters who are interested in service to others.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd55.name: Youth Development - Agricultural
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd55.description: Organizations like 4-H Club, and Future Homemakers that emphasize the total development of young people through work on animal, engineering, family/consumer health, resource, plant or social science projects in consultation with their parents and supervising adult volunteers. Members also participate in camping activities, leadership conferences, awards programs and community service activities.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd56.name: Youth Development - Business
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd56.description: Organizations like Junior Achievement that utilize volunteers from the teaching profession, business and industry to provide firsthand information about the business world for children and youth. Some clubs may also initiate small business ventures under the guidance of adult volunteers.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd57.name: Youth Development - Citizenship
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd57.description: Organizations like Youth Republic and Girls Nation that provide opportunities for young people to gain a clear understanding of the process of government and to develop an appreciation for their approaching citizenship responsibilities.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd58.name: Youth Development - Religious Leadership
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd58.description: Organizations like Youth for Christ, Campus Crusade for Christ and Liberal Religious Youth that provide a variety of recreational and social activities for young people with the objective of strengthening their religious values and meeting their spiritual needs as well as supporting their growth and development as individuals.

5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd59.name: Youth Development Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae2eda3c38c71367bd59.description: Organizations that clearly provide youth development services where the major purpose is unclear enough that a more specific code cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5a.name: Human Service Organizations
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5a.description: Organizations that provide a broad range of social services for individuals or families.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5b.name: American Red Cross
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5b.description: Separately incorporated, local chapters of the American Red Cross.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5c.name: Urban League
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5c.description: Separately incorporated, local Urban League sites.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5d.name: Salvation Army
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5d.description: Separately incorporated, local Salvation Army sites.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5e.name: Volunteers of America
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5e.description: Separately incorporated, local Volunteers of America sites.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5f.name: Young Mens or Womens Associations
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd5f.description: Separately incorporated, local YMCA, YWCA, YMHA, YWHA sites.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd60.name: Neighborhood Centers
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd60.description: Neighborhood-based multipurpose centers that offer, at a single location, a wide variety of services and activities that are structured to meet the needs of the entire community through different programs for different age and interest groups.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd61.name: Thrift Shops
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd61.description: Organizations that offer new or second-hand furniture, appliances, clothing, toys and other material goods at lower than retail prices, and which often use the proceeds from sales to support other services to the community. Thrift shops accept direct donations from the public of new and reusable goods.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd62.name: Children & Youth Services
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd62.description: Organizations that provide a wide variety of informational, social and supportive services for children and youth including runaways and other troubled youth.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd63.name: Adoption
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd63.description: Organizations that arrange permanent homes under new legal parentage for individuals whose birth parents are unable or unwilling to provide for their care.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd64.name: Foster Care
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd64.description: Organizations that provide an alternative family living arrangement in agency-supervised family homes for dependent children who have been removed from their homes because of abuse, neglect or abandonment; or for children or adults with disabilities who are unable to live with their birth families or in an independent setting.
keywords: Foster Care for Adults with Disabilities
Foster Care for Children with Disabilities

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd65.name: Child Day Care
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd65.description: Organizations that provide substitute parental care for children during some portion of a twenty-four hour day.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd66.name: Family Services
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd66.description: Organizations that provide a wide variety of social services that are designed to support healthy family development, improve the familys ability to resolve problems and prevent the need for unnecessary placement of children in settings outside the home.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd67.name: Single Parent Agencies
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd67.description: Organizations like Parents Without Partners that provide supportive services for single parents.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd68.name: Family Violence Shelters
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd68.description: Organizations that provide temporary shelter for women who have experienced domestic violence and for their children.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd69.name: In-Home Assistance
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd69.description: Organizations that provide assistance in performing routine household, yard and personal care activities for frail elderly, disabled or indigent individuals or families whose normal routines have been disrupted by an emergency.
keywords:
Yard Work
See also: Home Health Care

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6a.name: Family Services for Adolescent Parents
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6a.description: Organizations that provide pregnancy counseling, maternity home care and other supportive services for pregnant adolescents or adolescents who are parents.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6b.name: Family Counseling
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6b.description: Organizations that offer therapeutic sessions which focus on the system of relationships and communication patterns among family members and which attempt to modify those relationships and patterns to achieve greater harmony. The therapist focuses on the family as a unit rather than concentrating on one of the members who is singled out as the one in need of treatment.

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6c.name: Pregnancy Centers
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6c.description: Organizations that provide free and confidential services to women and families facing unplanned pregnancies.  Services can include pregnancy testing and physician exams with ultrasound, counseling on pregnancy-related issues, information on STDs, healthcare & community referrals, and help with material goods such as maternity and baby items.
keywords: Crisis Pregnancy Centers, Pregnancy Centers, Pregnancy Care Centers

5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6d.name: Personal Social Services
5bb3ae2fda3c38c71367bd6d.description: Organizations that provide a variety of personal social services or which offer personal social services not specified below.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd6e.name: Financial Counseling
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd6e.description: Organizations that provide advice and guidance for people who need assistance in obtaining credit, obtaining or correcting information in their credit records, reducing their debt burden or managing their financial resources more effectively.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd6f.name: Transportation Assistance
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd6f.description: Organizations that provide or coordinate free or low-cost transportation services for older adults, people with disabilities, people with medical conditions, people who are indigent, students and other eligible individuals.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd70.name: Gift Distribution
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd70.description: Organizations - like Toys for Tots - that provide, coordinate or raise money and donations for holiday assistance and gift distribution programs, usually but not exclusively organized around holidays.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd71.name: Emergency Assistance
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd71.description: Organizations that provide food, clothing, household goods, cash and other forms of short-term emergency assistance for indigent individuals and families who have insufficient resources to meet their basic needs.
keywords: Return to Point of Origin Assistance

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd72.name: Travelers Aid
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd72.description: Organizations that provide supportive services including information and emergency assistance for tourists, travelers or other visitors who are stranded or have encountered other problems.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd73.name: Victims Services
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd73.description: Organizations that provide supportive services for crime victims which may include crisis counseling, medical services, escort services, transportation, child care, financial assistance, protective services, information about the mechanics of court proceedings, assistance with forms to file for reimbursement of crime-related expenses or losses, and/or advice and guidance concerning court appearances.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd74.name: Residential Care & Adult Day Programs
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd74.description: Organizations that provide alternative living arrangements for people who require care, supervision and support on a 24-hour basis or during part of the day.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd75.name: Adult Day Care
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd75.description: Organizations that provide personal care for dependent adults or adults with disabilities in a supervised group setting during some portion of a twenty-four hour day. Services may include social and recreational activities, training that is essential for sustaining the activities of daily living and meals, as appropriate.
keywords: Adult Development Centers for Persons with Disabilities

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd76.name: Group Homes
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd76.description: Facilities, usually located in residential neighborhoods, that provide 24-hour non-medical care for individuals with disabilities who need supervision and/or assistance with activities of daily living.
keywords: Group Homes for Adults with Developmental Disabilities
Group Homes for Adults with Disabilities
Residential Care for Individuals with Disabilities

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd77.name: Hospices
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd77.description: Organizations that provide palliative and supportive services including medical care, pain and symptom management, home nurse visitation, case management, counseling, and bereavement services for terminally ill people who are in the final stages of their illnesses and for members of their families.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd78.name: Supportive Housing for Older Adults
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd78.description: Residential facilities for older adults who are unable to function in an independent living environment because they need assistance with toileting, bathing, dressing, medication, meals and housekeeping and other activities of daily living, but do not require nursing care on a regular basis.
keywords: Residential Care Facilities for the Elderly

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd79.name: Centers to Support the Independence of Specific Populations
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd79.description: Organizations that provide multipurpose centers or services that meet the needs and interests of a particular target population.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7a.name: Senior Centers
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7a.description: Organizations that provide or coordinate a wide variety of programs and services that meet the needs and interests of the senior population. Also included are organizations that administer funding for senior services under Title III of the Older Americans Act.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7b.name: Developmentally Disabled Centers
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7b.description: Organizations such as retarded citizens associations that provide or coordinate a wide variety of programs and services for people with developmental disabilities.
keywords: Day Programs for the Developmentally Disabled
Drop in Centers for the Developmentally Disabled
Independent Living Skills Instruction: Mentally Retarded Centers

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7c.name: Ethnic &  Immigrant Centers
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7c.description: Organizations that provide or coordinate a wide variety of programs and services that are structured to meet the social, educational, economic, recreational and other needs of specific ethnic and/or immigrant groups in ways that are culturally appropriate.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7d.name: Homeless Centers
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7d.description: Organizations that provide supportive services for individuals and families who are homeless or which work with people who are at risk for homelessness in an effort to prevent them from losing their permanent residence.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7e.name: Blind & Visually Impaired Centers
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7e.description: Organizations that provide or coordinate a wide variety of programs and services for people who are blind or have visual impairments.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7f.name: Deaf & Hearing Impaired Centers
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd7f.description: Organizations that provide or coordinate a wide variety of programs and services for people who are deaf or have hearing impairments.

5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd80.name: LGBT Centers
5bb3ae30da3c38c71367bd80.description: Organizations that provide or coordinate a wide variety of programs and services that meet the needs and interests of people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgenedered.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd81.name: Human Services Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd81.description: Organizations that clearly provide human services where the major purpose is unclear enough that a more specific code cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd82.name: Civil Rights
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd82.description: Organizations that work for the passage and enforcement of laws or other social measures that will more effectively protect the rights of specific groups.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd83.name: Minority Rights
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd83.description: Organizations that support the passage and enforcement of laws and other social measures that protect and promote the rights and interests of one or more specific ethnic groups or individuals who have a common national origin.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd84.name: Disabled Persons Rights
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd84.description: Organizations that support the passage and enforcement of laws or other social measures that protect the rights of people who have disabilities and maximize their ability to enjoy the same opportunities, resources and privileges as the mainstream population.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd85.name: Seniors Rights
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd85.description: Organizations that support the passage and enforcement of laws and other social measures that protect and promote the rights of older adults.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd86.name: Lesbian & Gay Rights
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd86.description: Organizations that support the passage and enforcement of laws and other social measures that protect and promote the rights and interests of individuals who are gay, lesbian, bisexual, or transgender.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd87.name: Children's Rights
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd87.description: Organizations that support the passage and enforcement of laws and other social measures that protect and promote the rights and interests of children and youth.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd88.name: Intergroup & Race Relations
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd88.description: Organizations that work for increased harmony and understanding among diverse groups in the community and to reduce or eliminate tensions and violence based on age, gender, race, color, sexual preference, creed, national origin, income level or stereotypical identification.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd89.name: Voter Education & Registration
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd89.description: Organizations that encourage citizens to participate in the political process, in a nonpartisan manner, by providing opportunities for political involvement, access to public officials, information that is necessary to make informed decisions at the ballot box or assistance in registering to vote.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8a.name: Civil Liberties
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8a.description: Organizations that protect the rights of people guaranteed by the Constitution and promote the passage of laws or other social measures that extend individual rights or more effectively protect them.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8b.name: Reproductive Rights
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8b.description: Organizations that support the passage and enforcement of laws and other social measures which preserve a womans right to terminate her pregnancy.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8c.name: Right to Life
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8c.description: Organizations that support the passage of legislation which assigns legal rights to the unborn and seeks to criminalize the termination of unwanted pregnancies.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8d.name: Censorship, Freedom of Speech & Press
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8d.description: Organizations that support the right of the press to freedom of expression without censorship or other restrictions by government and/or which support the right of the media to maintain confidential sources.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8e.name: Right to Die & Euthanasia
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8e.description: Organizations that support the right of people who may be terminally ill to end their own lives in a planned manner either by active means or by the removal of life-support systems.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8f.name: Civil Rights, Social Action & Advocacy Not Elsewhere Classified
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd8f.description: Organizations that clearly provide civil rights, social action or advocacy services where the major purpose is unclear enough that a more specific code cannot be accurately assigned.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd90.name: Military & Veterans Organizations
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd90.description: Membership organizations that are engaged in promoting the interests of the veterans or active or retired military personnel who are their members.
keywords: Armed Forces of the United States

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd91.name: Public Transportation Systems
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd91.description: Organizations that provide fixed-route mass transit services that utilize buses, trains, ferry boats or other vehicles to transport people within the limits of a city, a metropolitan area, a county or a multi-county region, or to move people from outlying areas into a city or metropolitan area.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd92.name: Telecommunications
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd92.description: Organizations that furnish point-to-point communications services including telephone and telegraph services.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd93.name: Financial Institutions
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd93.description: Organizations that provide an alternative to the traditional banking system for people who want to maintain checking or savings accounts, purchase money orders, cash third-party checks or engage in other financial transactions.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd94.name: Credit Unions
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd94.description: Cooperative 501(c)(14) associations that use money deposited by a group of people (e.g., fellow employees) and lend it out again to people in the same group at favorable interest rates.

5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd95.name: Public Utilities
5bb3ae31da3c38c71367bd95.description: Organizations that provide gas, electricity, water and sanitary services including the hook-up of services and the installation, maintenance and repair of necessary equipment.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd96.name: Consumer Protection
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd96.description: Organizations that provide for the education and protection of individuals who purchase, use, maintain and dispose of products and services.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd97.name: Christianity
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd97.description: Religious organizations that provide opportunities for people to satisfy their inner needs and enhance their spiritual growth through organized worship or through other devotional activities under the auspices of one of the group of religious faiths that is based on the teachings of Jesus Christ.
keywords: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints
Church of the Latter Day Saints
Holy Apostolic Catholic Assyrian Church of the East

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd98.name: Protestant
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd98.description: Religious organizations whose form of Christian faith and practice originated with the principles of the Reformation.
keywords: Apostolic Assembly of the Faith in Christ Jesus
Apostolic Overcoming Holy Church of God (A.O.H.)
Church of Our Lord Jesus Christ
House of God Saints in Christ
International Church of the Foursquare Gospel
Quakers, Redeemed Christian Church of God

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd99.name: Roman Catholic
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd99.description: Religious organizations characterized by their acknowledgement of the supreme authority of the bishop of Rome, the pope, in matters of faith.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9a.name: Judaism
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9a.description: Organizations whose members are a worldwide group which constitutes a continuation through descent or conversion of the ancient Jewish people; who practice Judaism, a religion that is characterized by a belief in one God and in the mission of Jews to teach the oneness of God as revealed in the Hebrew scriptures. Organizations making reference to Lubavitch, Chabad, Yeshiva, and Torah should also be classified here, but not necessarily those mentioning Israel, Hebrew, and Shalom.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9b.name: Islam
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9b.description: Organizations whose members are followers of Islam, the religious faith and cultural system that is based on the belief in Allah as the sole deity, in Mohammed as the prophet of Allah and in the Koran as the revelation of Allah to Mohammed and the divinely authorized basis for the religious, social, civil, commercial, military and legal regulations of the Islamic world.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9c.name: Buddhism
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9c.description: Organizations whose members are followers of the religion of eastern and central Asia that is based on the teachings of Gautama Buddha which stress that suffering is inherent in life and that one can achieve nirvana (release from suffering) through mental and moral self-purification. Includes Zen.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9d.name: Hinduism
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9d.description: Organizations whose members are followers of the religious philosophy that originated on the Indian subcontinent and is marked by an outlook that tends to view all forms and theories as aspects of one eternal being and truth; a belief in ahimsa, karma, dharma, samsara and moksha; and the practice of the way of works, the way of knowledge or the way of devotion as the means of release from the round of rebirths.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9e.name: Interfaith Coalitions
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9e.description: Organizations representing multiple faiths that have gathered together to establish a worldwide Christian (or other religious) unity; to promote cooperation on such common tasks as supporting missions, working with students and sponsoring conferences; to establish mutual understanding regarding the fundamental issues of belief, worship and polity; and to serve as a united witness on world problems.
keywords: National Conference of Christians and Jews

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9f.name: Cooling Center
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bd9f.description: A cooling center is a air-conditioned public space set up by local authorities to temporarily deal with the health effects of a heat wave. Cooling centers are meant to prevent hyperthermia caused by heat, humidity, and poor air quality. Cooling centers provide shade, water, and restrooms; medical attention and referrals to social services may also be offered. Their services are aimed at the homeless, at-risk populations such as the elderly, and those without air conditioning.

5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bda0.name: Dental Services
5bb3ae32da3c38c71367bda0.description: Organizations dedicated to the study, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases, disorders and conditions of the oral cavity, commonly in the dentition but also the oral mucosa, and of adjacent and related structures and tissues, particularly in the maxillofacial (jaw and facial) area.

5bb4ce6dda3c38c9a74a1c6f.name: Mental Health First Aid Training
5bb4ce6dda3c38c9a74a1c6f.description: Mental health first aid is a training program that teaches members of the public how to help a person developing a mental health problem (including a substance use problem), experiencing a worsening of an existing mental health problem, or in a mental health crisis. Like traditional first aid, Mental Health First Aid does not teach people to treat or diagnose mental health or substance use conditions. Instead, the training teaches people how to offer initial support until appropriate professional help is received or until the crisis resolves.

5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0240.name: Education
5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0240.description: Organizations dedicated to the act or process of imparting or acquiring general knowledge, developing the powers of reasoning and judgment, and generally of preparing oneself or others intellectually for mature life.

5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0241.name: Environment
5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0241.description: Organizations whose primary purpose is to preserve, protect and improve the environment. Includes: Organizations that are involved in pollution control and abatement; conservation and development of natural resources; control or elimination of hazardous or toxic substances including pesticides; solid waste management; urban beautification and open spaces development; environmental education and outdoor survival; and botanical gardens and horticultural societies.

5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0242.name: Animal-Related
5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0242.description: Organizations whose primary purpose is to provide for the care, protection and control of wildlife and domestic animals that are a part of the living environment; to help people develop an understanding of their pets; and to train animals for purposes of showing. Includes: Organizations that develop and maintain fisheries resources and wildlife habitats to preserve and protect endangered species and other wildlife; humane societies; veterinary services; aquariums; and zoos.

5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0243.name: Health Care
5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0243.description: Organizations dedicated to the maintenance or restoration of the health of the body or mind.

5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0244.name: Mental Health & Crisis Intervention
5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0244.description: Organizations dedicated to the psychological well-being and satisfactory adjustment to society and to the ordinary demands of life.

5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0245.name: Voluntary Health Associations & Medical Disciplines
5bc787d9da3c38f0620b0245.description: Also known as patient advocacy organizations, VHAs are composed of individuals, both lay and professional, voluntarily and democratically organized. Their mission is to combat a particular disease, disability, or group of diseases and disabilities, or to improve and protect the health of a particular group of people.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b0246.name: Crime & Legal-Related
5bc787dada3c38f0620b0246.description: Organizations dedicated to addressing actions or omissions that constitute an offense that may be prosecuted by the state and may be punishable by law.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b0247.name: Employment
5bc787dada3c38f0620b0247.description: Organizations dedicated to helping people prepare for, find, secure, retain, or receive fair remuneration for safe, suitable employment.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b0248.name: Food, Agriculture & Nutrition
5bc787dada3c38f0620b0248.description: Organizations that focus on the development, improvement, or distribution of food resources.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b0249.name: Housing & Shelter
5bc787dada3c38f0620b0249.description: Organizations that help people develop, construct, manage, or secure temporary or permanent housing.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b024a.name: Public Safety, Disaster Preparedness & Relief
5bc787dada3c38f0620b024a.description: Organizations dedicated to the process of preparing for or responding to man-made and natural disasters.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b024b.name: Recreation & Sports
5bc787dada3c38f0620b024b.description: Organizations dedicated to the refreshment of strength and spirits through organized and unorganized play.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b024c.name: Youth Development
5bc787dada3c38f0620b024c.description: Organizations dedicated to the preparation of young people to meed the challenges of adolescence and adulthood and achieve their full potential.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b024d.name: Human Services
5bc787dada3c38f0620b024d.description: Organizations dedicated to meeting basic health, welfare, and other needs of a society or group.

5bc787dada3c38f0620b024e.name: Civil Rights, Social Action & Advocacy
5bc787dada3c38f0620b024e.description: Organizations whose primary purpose is to protect and promote the broad civil rights of groups and civil liberties of individuals, to work for the realization of specific social or political goals or to encourage the participation of people in the public policy debate. Includes: Organizations that work to improve relations between racial, ethnic, and cultural groups; advocacy and citizen action groups that work to change public policy and opinion in a variety of areas; organizations that use courts to protect and enlarge civil rights and liberties; and organizations that promote voter education and registration.

5bc787dbda3c38f0620b024f.name: Public & Societal Benefit
5bc787dbda3c38f0620b024f.description: Organizations that support government administration, veterans' interests, public transportation systems, telecommunications, financial institutions leadership development, public utilities, or consumer protection.

5bc787dbda3c38f0620b0250.name: Religion-Related
5bc787dbda3c38f0620b0250.description: Organizations dedicated to a set of beliefs concerning the cause, nature, and purpose of the universe, especially when considered as the creation of a superhuman agency or agencies, usually involving devotional and ritual observances, and often containing a moral code governing the conduct of human affairs.

5c929881a4f5428e5fce6afa.name: Obstetrics & Gynecology
5c929881a4f5428e5fce6afa.description: Organizations that provide preventive, diagnostic and treatment services for women and girls with regards to the female reproductive system, pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period.
